newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Mobil Australia posts small profit rise.
newsitem.headline: Mobil Australia posts small profit rise.

text.p: Mobil Australia Ltd, a unit of Mobil Corp, said on Monday its profit after tax and interest rose slightly to A$75.4 million in calendar 1996 from A$73.7 million the previous year.
A Mobil spokesman said the company was happy it had been able to increase profit, but said the result represented an unsatisfactory return on capital of about three percent.
Mobil Australia has an asset base of about A$2.6 billion.
"We put in place some business initiatives over 1996 which meant we were able to offset the impact of very poor refining margins and very poor marketing margins," the spokesman said.
"(But) the net effect is that those business initiatives have been wiped away by what has happened in the marketplace to margins," the spokesman said.
"It reflects what is a very tough competitive environment."
British Petroleum Co Plc unit BP Australia earlier this month reported a 38 percent fall in net profit in calendar 1996 to A$124 million.
Mobil owns 700 retail petrol sites in Australian and supplies a further 1,800 through its Melbourne refinery.
